title: Vitthal-Rukmini Temple, Alandi
subtitle: Sacred Town of Sant Dnyaneshwar Maharaj on the Banks of Indrayani River
overview: Alandi, situated on the banks of the holy Indrayani River near Pune, is one of Maharashtra’s most revered pilgrimage sites. It is closely associated with Sant Dnyaneshwar Maharaj, the great saint and philosopher who authored the Dnyaneshwari — a Marathi commentary on the Bhagavad Gita.
The Vitthal-Rukmini Temple here attracts lakhs of devotees, particularly Warkaris, who gather annually for the Palkhi procession that travels from Alandi to Pandharpur.
Alandi’s spiritual aura, river ghats, and historic temples create a divine atmosphere of devotion and peace.

highlights.title: Sant Dnyaneshwar Samadhi Mandir
highlights.description: The sacred resting place of Sant Dnyaneshwar Maharaj, visited by devotees throughout the year.

highlights.title: Indrayani River Ghats
highlights.description: Holy riverbank where pilgrims bathe and perform rituals before temple visits.

highlights.title: Annual Dnyaneshwar Palkhi
highlights.description: The grand procession begins from Alandi and culminates in Pandharpur, uniting lakhs of devotees in devotion.

geography.intro: Alandi is located in Pune district, around 25 km northeast of Pune city, along the Indrayani River in western Maharashtra.

climate.description: Alandi enjoys a moderate climate similar to Pune, with warm summers, cool winters, and heavy monsoon rains.

geography.conclusion: The divine presence of Sant Dnyaneshwar and the peaceful Indrayani River make Alandi a symbol of spiritual devotion and unity in Maharashtra.

activities.title: Darshan at Vitthal-Rukmini Temple
activities.description: Seek blessings of Lord Vitthal and Rukmini in this serene and sacred temple environment.
info: Temple open daily from 5 AM to 9 PM.
Special rituals on Ekadashi and Palkhi days.

activities.title: Visit Sant Dnyaneshwar Samadhi Mandir
activities.description: Pay homage at the holy Samadhi where Sant Dnyaneshwar Maharaj attained eternal rest.
info: Located adjacent to the main temple complex.

activities.title: Participate in the Dnyaneshwar Palkhi
activities.description: Join thousands of devotees on their journey to Pandharpur in devotion to Lord Vitthal.
info: Traditional Warkari chants and Abhangas fill the air.

attractions.title: Sant Dnyaneshwar Samadhi Mandir
attractions.description: A historic and spiritual site where Sant Dnyaneshwar Maharaj took Samadhi over 700 years ago.

attractions.title: Indrayani River Ghat
attractions.description: Peaceful riverbank where pilgrims perform rituals and enjoy the serene beauty of the flowing river.

marineLife.intro: While not coastal, the Indrayani River supports local aquatic biodiversity and sustains the surrounding ecosystem.

items.title: Freshwater Aquatic Life
items.description: The Indrayani River sustains small fish species and provides a habitat for local birds and flora.

items.title: Eco Harmony
items.description: Alandi’s natural surroundings blend spiritual tranquility with environmental balance.

conclusion: The Indrayani symbolizes purity and devotion in the Warkari tradition.
Alandi’s ecosystem remains deeply connected with its spiritual heritage.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Alandi can be accessed via Pune Railway Station (25 km).
Local buses and taxis available to reach the temple.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Regular MSRTC and private buses operate from Pune, Nashik, and Ahmednagar.
Alandi is well-connected by the Pune-Nashik Highway.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest airport: Pune International Airport (28 km).
Frequent cabs and buses to Alandi.

bookingTips.description: Visit during the Dnyaneshwar Palkhi Yatra for an immersive spiritual experience.
Early mornings are ideal for peaceful darshan and rituals by the Indrayani River.
Book local dharmashalas or lodges in advance during pilgrimage season.
